item.title: Sandra Hemme’s 43-Year Fight for Innocence Reflects Pitfalls in Missouri’s Justice System
item.description: Even after a judge declared her innocent and ordered her freed, the Missouri attorney general tried to send her back.

item.title: Why Some Doctors Are Pushing to End Routine Drug Testing During Childbirth
item.description: Hospitals routinely report parents to child welfare authorities based on error-prone drug tests. Some hospitals are changing policy as a result.

item.title: These States Have Investigated Miscarriages and Stillbirths as Crimes
item.description: A recent arrest in Georgia highlights the criminal suspicion that surrounds pregnancy loss in several states, experts say.

item.title: Trump’s Union Order Endangers Federal Prison Officers, Labor Leaders Say
item.description: Supporters of the union, which represents 30,000 prison employees, fear the move will worsen an ongoing staffing crisis.

item.title: How States Are Undoing Criminal Justice Reforms
item.description: Louisiana, New York and other states are rolling back reforms — and efforts to reduce excessive sentencing or expand parole are smaller in scope.
